page.title: 15BREAN DOWN AND TRANSPORT
page.content: THE HISTORY OF BREAN DOWN AND ITS USE AS A FORT HAS ALREADY BEEN RECORDED.ITS PLACE IN THE HISTORY OF TRANSPORT AND FUTURE TRANSPORT IS THE SUBJECT OF THIS PAGE. WHEN THE RAILWAYS REACHED SOMERSET, A GROUP OF LOCAL PEOPLE LOOKED WESTWARD AND HAD VISIONS OF ESTABLISHING A HARBOUR ON THE NORTH OF THE DOWN.IT WOULD HAVE BEEN THE NEAREST BRITISH PORT TO AMERICA.WORK STARTED BUT WAS WRECKED BY GALES WHICH NOT ONLY DEMOLISHED THE WORK BEGUN,BUT ALSO SANK THE PROJECT. IN RECENT YEARS THE POSSIBILITY OF A BARRAGE FROM BREAN DOWN BY THE WAY OF STEEPHOLME,AND FLATHOLME TO LAVENACK POINT IN SOUTH WALES HAS BEEN WELL RESEARCHED.SUCH SCHEME WOULD NOT ONLY USE THE TIDE TO PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED ELECTRICITY BUT ALSO A ROAD LINKING THE SOUTH WEST OF ENGLAND TO SOUTH WALES.
